sentence.Network_en: Platoon sergeants fell their men in on the barrack square.
sentence.Network_cn: 排长们在营房广场上整顿队伍.

sentence.Network_en: The battalion formed up by companies on the barrack square.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个营在营地广场上排成以连为单位的队列.

sentence.Network_en: The soldiers were at drill in the barrack - yard .
sentence.Network_cn: 士兵们在兵营 练兵场 操练.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 19th cent.: probably from Northern Irish dialect

entry.def: A barracks is a building or group of buildings where soldiers or other members of the armed forces live and work. 'Barracks' is the singular and plural form.

example.ex: ...an army barracks in the north of the city.

entry.def: If people in an audience barrack public speakers or performers, they interrupt them, for example by making rude remarks.

example.ex: Fans gained more enjoyment barracking him than cheering on the team...
example.tran: 球迷一个劲儿地嘘他，兴头远胜于为球队加油。

example.ex: President Alan Garcia was barracked by the right wing opposition.
example.tran: 阿兰·加西亚总统遭右翼反对派喝倒彩。

means.word_mean: 1. a building used to house military personnel
2. urge on or encourage especially by shouts;
3. laugh at with contempt and derision;
